definition: to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke

sentences.english: B----Oh, Come on, high cal is exactly the thing we need here!
sentences.chinese: 哦，开什么玩笑，高卡路里正是我们需要的。

sentences.english: Really wired to see a Dolphin pull-off that joke!
sentences.chinese: 看到海豚开这样的玩笑真的很兴奋。

sentences.english: Jest with an ass and he will flap you in the face with his tail.
sentences.chinese: 你跟驴子开玩笑，将被驴尾打耳光。

sentences.english: Chen Jiaying is Laojiang Hu that she would take hasty to Faye Wong in the stomach joke?
sentences.chinese: 陈家瑛是老江湖，她会草率到拿王菲的肚子开玩笑吗？

sentences.english: The joke finally made the man in a suit smile.
sentences.chinese: 玩笑最终让这个穿着西装的人有了点笑意。

sentences.english: LL: I really was just kidding, Li Hua. You're not a big baby.
sentences.chinese: 你惹急了我就说是开玩笑。

sentences.english: We drank cheap Shancheng Beer, we joked around, we took turns singing songs.
sentences.chinese: 我们喝了廉价的山城啤酒，我们开玩笑，轮流唱歌。

sentences.english: He often parenthesizes a talk with jokes.
sentences.chinese: 他常常在交谈中插入几句玩笑话。

sentences.english: I decided to treat his remark as jok .
sentences.chinese: 我把他的话当做玩笑话。

sentences.english: Tom—honest injun, now—is it fun, or earnest?
sentences.chinese: 汤姆，你是开玩笑，还是说真格的？

sentences.english: At which point I understood that the whole thing had been a joke.
sentences.chinese: 我明白无论从那个角度讲，整个事情都是一个玩笑。

sentences.english: That magic wine was just a joke she played on me.
sentences.chinese: 其实“醉生梦死”只不过是她跟我开的一个玩笑。

sentences.english: After the joke, it's just a sad.
sentences.chinese: 玩笑过后，只是一途伤感。

sentences.english: His father laughs and says the boy jumped six and nine-tenths inches.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲开玩笑说小男孩跳了六寸多高。

sentences.english: But I was in a mood, so I made a joke.
sentences.chinese: 但我当时正闹情绪，所以我开了一个玩笑。

definition: to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
to mock oneself/to laugh at oneself
(of a defect etc) to be of no great matter (idiom)/harmless
to chat and laugh/to crack jokes/to banter
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
practical joke/prank/to play a practical joke
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to refer to one's foibles or failings with self-deprecating humor
